comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: I am not understanding - what is the price? we decide what we pay? what if someone says zero, they still get one?

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on July 17, 2022, 01:03:22 PMI am not understanding - what is the price? we decide what we pay? what if someone says zero, they still get one?I kind of took it like bandcamp.com - You just pick what you want to pay (0 is sometimes allowed)?, and then pay for shipping (N/A on bandcamp, as it's digital music). I hope nobody would even ask to get one for free, that'd just be rude IMO.

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on July 17, 2022, 01:03:22 PMI am not understanding - what is the price? we decide what we pay? what if someone says zero, they still get one?That's the idea, I want let people decide what they want to pay. I can't accept zero. Maybe in the future I will make raffles like that but right now I can't do it. I wanted to create something interesting and new. I want to make my art available for everyone.

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: This piece represents the millions of people who feel voiceless and powerless, and asks the questions: who am I, why am I here, and why do I look like this?But fear not, dear friends. There will be answers. Soon! The first edition of this artwork will include the original sketch I drew while fighting for my life in the hospital. This piece is a testament to the human spirit and its indomitable will to survive and thrive.Don't miss your chance to own a piece of this powerful narrative. Check out the thread and make an offer today!With love mx12

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: Hey there, my incredible community! I wanted to take a moment to share a deeply personal and thought-provoking artwork with you all. "Millions of People" captures the feelings of voicelessness and powerlessness that many individuals experience. It raises profound questions about identity, purpose, and our shared existence. As the artist behind this piece, I poured my emotions and journey into its creation. It holds a special place in my heart. I'm still eagerly awaiting the first sale of this artwork, as the initial auction encountered issues with shipping, and the buyer couldn't wait for its arrival. But don't worry, answers to the questions raised within this artwork will be revealed soon. Stay tuned for updates and let's continue our artistic journey together.

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: Hey, Bitcointalk community,This artwork has been a constant in my journey, a piece that's been through auctions and even found a new home once, only to be returned due to some shipping mishaps. I can't help but feel deeply connected to this one, it's my absolute favorite in the entire collection. The story behind it runs deep, I sketched it during a time spent in the clinic, a place that marked almost a year of my life.But here's the thing, it's not just about the time or the personal connection, it's one of the most profound Bitcoin artworks I know. It doesn't flaunt a massive Bitcoin logo in the center, but it speaks volumes about waking up from a coma or feeling trapped in the fiat system, constantly pushed down. Life isn't all bad, and that's the essence of this piece, the reality we live in, and the slow, generational shift toward change.Surprisingly, it's still with me. I've often contemplated leaving it as a unique 1 of 1, but I don't want to deprive other collectors of the opportunity. I'm confident that someday, this artwork will find its new home, and when that moment arrives, it will happen swiftly. I can't help but wonder why it's still here with me, perhaps it's biding its time.Â  Let's leave it as 12 of 12 and see where it goes. Each month, each year, I have more to say about my artworks, and I find it cool to wait a few months before writing something about them.Let's see where this journey takes us. Thanks for being a part of it.
